==Events==
*  [[64]] &ndash; [[Great Fire of Rome]]: a fire begins to burn in the merchant area of Rome and soon burns completely out of control. According to a popular, but untrue legend, [[Nero]] fiddled as the city burned.
* [[484]] &ndash; [[Leontius (usurper)|Leontius]], Roman [[usurper]], is crowned Eastern emperor at [[Tarsus, Mersin|Tarsus]] (modern [[Turkey]]). He is recognized in [[Antioch]] and makes it his capital.
* [[711]] &ndash; [[Umayyad conquest of Hispania]]: [[Battle of Guadalete]] &ndash; [[Umayyad Caliphate|Umayyad]] forces under [[Tariq ibn Ziyad]] defeat the [[Visigoths]] led by King [[Roderic]].
*[[1333]] &ndash; [[Wars of Scottish Independence]]: [[Battle of Halidon Hill]] &ndash; The [[Kingdom of England|English]] win a decisive victory over the [[Kingdom of Scotland|Scots]].
*[[1544]] &ndash; [[Italian War of 1542–46]]: the first [[Sieges of Boulogne (1544–1546)|Siege of Boulogne]] begins.
*[[1545]] &ndash; The [[Tudor period|Tudor]] warship ''[[Mary Rose]]'' sinks off [[Portsmouth]]; in 1982 the wreck is salvaged in one of the most complex and expensive projects in the history of maritime archaeology.
*[[1553]] &ndash; [[Lady Jane Grey]] is replaced by [[Mary I of England]] as [[Queen regnant|Queen of England]] after only nine days on the throne.
*[[1588]] &ndash; [[Anglo-Spanish War (1585–1604)|Anglo-Spanish War]]: [[Spanish Armada#Battle of Gravelines|Battle of Gravelines]] &ndash; The [[Spanish Armada]] is sighted in the [[English Channel]].
*[[1701]] &ndash; Representatives of the [[Iroquois|Iroquois Confederacy]] sign the [[Nanfan Treaty]], ceding a large territory north of the [[Ohio River]] to [[Kingdom of England|England]].
*[[1702]] &ndash; [[Great Northern War]]: A numerically superior Polish-Saxon army of [[Augustus II the Strong]], operating from an advantageous defensive position, is defeated by a Swedish army half its size under the command of King [[Charles XII of Sweden|Charles XII]] in the [[Battle of Klissow]].
*[[1832]] &ndash; The [[British Medical Association]] is founded as the Provincial Medical and Surgical Association by Sir [[Charles Hastings (English physician)|Charles Hastings]] at a meeting in the Board Room of the [[Worcester]] Infirmary.
*[[1843]] &ndash; [[Isambard Kingdom Brunel|Brunel's]] [[Steamboat|steamship]] the [[SS Great Britain]] is launched, becoming the first ocean-going craft with an iron hull or [[Propeller (marine)#Marine|screw propeller]] and becoming the largest vessel afloat in the world.
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Women's rights]]: a two-day [[Seneca Falls Convention|Women's Rights Convention]] opens in [[Seneca Falls (hamlet), New York|Seneca Falls, New York]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Morgan's Raid]] &ndash; At [[Buffington Island]] in [[Ohio]], [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] [[General officer|General]] [[John Hunt Morgan]]'s raid into the north is mostly thwarted when a large group of his men are captured while trying to escape across the [[Ohio River]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[Taiping Rebellion]]: [[Third Battle of Nanking]] &ndash; The [[Qing dynasty]] finally defeats the [[Taiping Heavenly Kingdom]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Franco-Prussian War]]: France declares war on [[Prussia]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; The [[Paris Métro Line 1|first line]] of the [[Paris Métro]] opens for operation.
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Maurice Garin]] wins the [[1903 Tour de France|first Tour de France]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Battle of Fromelles]] &ndash; [[61st (2nd South Midland) Division|British]] and [[First Australian Imperial Force|Australian]] troops attack [[German Empire|German]] trenches in a prelude to the [[Battle of the Somme]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; Following Peace Day celebrations marking the end of [[World War I]], ex-servicemen riot and burn down [[Luton Town Hall]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Cape Spada]] &ndash; The [[Royal Navy]] and the [[Regia Marina]] clash; the Italian light cruiser [[Bartolomeo Colleoni#Italian cruiser Bartolomeo Colleoni|Bartolomeo Colleoni]] sinks, with 121 casualties.
* 1940 - [[1940 Field Marshal Ceremony]] First occasion in World War II, that Hitler appointed field marshals due to military achievements.
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: Army order 112 forms the [[Intelligence Corps (United Kingdom)|Intelligence Corps]] of the [[British Army]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: [[Battle of the Atlantic]] &ndash; [[Kriegsmarine|German]] [[Grand admiral|Grand Admiral]] [[Karl Dönitz]] orders the last [[U-boat]]s to withdraw from their United States [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic]] coast positions in response to the effective American convoy system.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: Rome is [[Bombing of Rome in World War II|heavily bombed]] by more than 500 Allied aircraft, inflicting thousands of casualties.
*[[1947]] &ndash;  The Prime Minister of the shadow [[Burma|Burmese]] government, Bogyoke [[Aung San]] and 6 of his [[Cabinet (government)|cabinet]] and 2 non-cabinet members are [[assassination|assassinated]] by Galon U Saw.
*  1947   &ndash; Korean politician [[Lyuh Woon-hyung]] is assassinated.
*[[1952]] &ndash; [[The 1952 Summer Olympics]], officially known as the Games of the XV Olympiad, were opened in [[Helsinki]], Finland.
*[[1961]] &ndash; Tunisia [[Bizerte crisis|imposes a blockade]] on the French naval base at [[Bizerte]]; the French would capture the entire town four days later.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Joseph A. Walker|Joe Walker]] flies a [[North American X-15]] to a record altitude of 106,010 meters (347,800 feet) on [[X-15 Flight 90]]. Exceeding an altitude of 100&nbsp;km, this flight qualifies as a [[human spaceflight]] under international convention.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: at a rally in [[Ho Chi Minh City|Saigon]], [[South Vietnam]]ese [[Prime minister|Prime Minister]] [[Nguyễn Khánh]] calls for expanding the war into [[North Vietnam]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Dhofar Rebellion]]: British [[Special Air Service|SAS]] units help the [[Oman]]i government against [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Oman]] rebels in the [[Battle of Mirbat]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Sagarmatha National Park]] in [[Nepal]] is created.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[Sandinista National Liberation Front|Sandinista]] rebels overthrow the [[government]] of the [[Anastasio Somoza Debayle|Somoza]] family in [[Nicaragua]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; In a private meeting with U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]], French Prime Minister [[François Mitterrand]] reveals the existence of the [[Farewell Dossier]], a collection of documents showing that the Soviets had been stealing American technological research and development.
*[[1983]] &ndash; The first [[Michael W. Vannier|three-dimensional reconstruction]] of a human head in a [[X-ray computed tomography|CT]] is published.
*[[1985]] &ndash; The [[Val di Stava dam collapse]]s killing 268 people in Val di Stava, Italy.
*[[1992]] &ndash; A car bomb placed by mafia with collaboration of Italian intelligence [[Massacre of Via D'Amelio|kills Judge Paolo Borsellino]] and five members of his escort
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] resumes a ceasefire to end their [[Provisional Irish Republican Army campaign 1969–1997|25-year campaign]] to end British rule in Northern Ireland.
